page.title: 06SILK WILLOUGHBY VILLAGE HALL
page.content: {Silk Willoughby village hall}was built in 1858 as a{school}run by the{Church {of England. In 1978 it was bought from the Church authorities by the village and since then has been run by a management committee, formed of various members from several organisations in the community. The hall is used by a large percentage of the village population. A typical week would start with{Sunday School,}held on alternate Sundays. As the village no longer has its own vicar, it is supervised by a local school teacher and her daughter. About 12 children attend. On Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday mornings a{playgroup}is held for between 15 and 20 children. The hall is used as a{polling station and for adults' and children's parties.
